citations.narrative:
***The sugar glider enclosures are stacked directly over each other with open bottoms. The facility has stopped using the
trays in the bottom of the enclosures which are meant to catch waste material from the cage. The waste material per
enclosure is now able to fall through each enclosure into the enclosure below and onto the floor. This process causes
cross contamination of the animals housed at the lower levels. The waste material has accumulated on the floor and
throughout the room causing increased presence of flying insects that can be a nuisance to the sugar gliders causing
discomfort. The licensee stated due to loss of an employee and personal health issues the room has not been cleaned in
two weeks causing an increase in the accumulation of waste material.
The room shall be cleaned and the enclosures protected to prevent cross contamination to protect the health and well-
being of the sugar gliders. Correct by March 5, 2025.

***The excessive accumulation of waste material on the floors in the sugar glider room has attracted small flying insects.
The presence of these insects is a nuisance that may cause discomfort to the sugar gliders. Flying insects also pose a
risk of disease hazard and contamination that may result in illness.
The room shall be cleaned and sanitized and a safe and effective program for the control of insects established and
maintained. Correct by March 5, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
***The sugar glider enclosures are stacked directly over each other with open bottoms. The facility has stopped using the 
trays in the bottom of the enclosures which are meant to catch waste material from the cage. The waste material per 
enclosure is now able to fall through each enclosure into the enclosure below and onto the floor. This process causes 
cross contamination of the animals housed at the lower levels. The waste material has accumulated on the floor and 
throughout the room causing increased presence of flying insects that can be a nuisance to the sugar gliders causing 
discomfort. The licensee stated due to loss of an employee and personal health issues the room has not been cleaned in 
two weeks causing an increase in the accumulation of waste material. 
 
The room shall be cleaned and the enclosures protected to prevent cross contamination to protect the health and well-
being of the sugar gliders. Correct by March 5, 2025. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
***The excessive accumulation of waste material on the floors in the sugar glider room has attracted small flying insects. 
The presence of these insects is a nuisance that may cause discomfort to the sugar gliders. Flying insects also pose a 
risk of disease hazard and contamination that may result in illness.  
 
The room shall be cleaned and sanitized and a safe and effective program for the control of insects established and 
maintained. Correct by March 5, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
